1.text: THE song of songs, which is Solomon’s.

2.text: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth—For thy love is better than wine.

3.text: Thine ointments have a goodly fragrance; Thy name is as ointment poured forth; Therefore do the maidens love thee.

4.text: Draw me, we will run after thee; The king hath brought me into his chambers; We will be glad and rejoice in thee, We will find thy love more fragrant than wine! Sincerely do they love thee.

5.text: I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, As the tents of Kedar, As the curtains of Solomon.

6.text: Look not upon me, that I am swarthy, That the sun hath tanned me; My mother’s sons were incensed against me, They made me keeper of the vineyards; But mine own vineyard have I not kept.’

7.text: Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, Where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon; For why should I be as one that veileth herself Beside the flocks of thy companions?

8.text: If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, Go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock And feed thy kids, beside the shepherds’ tents.

9.text: I have compared thee, O my love, To a steed in Pharaoh’s chariots.

10.text: Thy cheeks are comely with circlets, Thy neck with beads.

11.text: We will make thee circlets of gold With studs of silver.

12.text: While the king sat at his table, My spikenard sent forth its fragrance.

13.text: My beloved is unto me as a bag of myrrh, That lieth betwixt my breasts.

14.text: My beloved is unto me as a cluster of henna In the vineyards of En-gedi.

15.text: Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; Thine eyes are as doves.

16.text: Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant; Also our couch is leafy.

17.text: The beams of our houses are cedars, And our panels are cypresses.
